Topic.Title: You can tell that shorts here know that they're in trouble.

Message.Msg: You didn't hear me say that. If nothing changes in the investment world then Amazon has conditioned the investment world and vice versa that only revenue growth matters. Amazon knows their revenue growth is slowing so they have to figure out ways to sell more stuff. This will be another money losing business but if the world's response to Amazon hasn't changed then selling groceries on-line as a loss leader won't matter, it will only help. Same old, same old. Or is it? Eventually a few more analysts may turn on the company as the evidence or horrific metrics just becomes too evident or more likely they are instructed to do so by someone with big money. Think this can't/won't happen?

Message.Msg: I am entitled to post as much as I can.
